entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.8)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version!

We had to move some sessions, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Getting started with (modern) Python packaging” by Filipe Laíns (Sept. 8, 2023, 5:30 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 4:55 p.m.)
  • “Esmerald and Saffier - Complex Python made it easy with async” by Tiago Silva, Pedro Correia (Sept. 8, 2023, 4:55 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 5:30 p.m.)

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.7)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version!

We had to move some sessions, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “CPython Survival Kit: basic C concepts to understand Python better” by Cristián Maureira-Fredes (Sept. 8, 2023, 10:15 a.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 9:15 a.m.)
  • “Breaking Bias: PyWomen = 0 #ErrorAlert” by Cláudia Mendes (Sept. 8, 2023, 9:15 a.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 9:50 a.m.)

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.6)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version!

We have a new session: “Building advanced back-office interfaces using Django & HTMX” by Lucas Pires .

We sadly had to cancel a session: “Django Apps at Scale: Mistakes to Avoid” by Kushal Vijay.

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.5)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version!

We sadly had to cancel a session: “Image recognition using Python, PyTorch, OpenAI and Streamlit in Snowflake” by Dash.

We have moved a session around: “MicroPython and time series analysis: Forecasting and trend analysis” by Olaniyan Adewale, Sulaiman Adisa Adigun (Auditorium → Workshop I)

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.4)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version!

We have a new session: “Comprehending Comprehensions” by Rodrigo Girão Serrão .

We sadly had to cancel a session: “Debugging and Troubleshooting Python Applications: Leveraging Visibility and Observability to Solve Problems Faster” by Neeraj Pandey.

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.3)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version!
Due to speakers requests or constraints, some talks changed slots/days or where dropped.
Second Keynote and a new workshop was added.

We have new sessions!

  • “Breaking Bias: PyWomen = 0 #ErrorAlert”
  • “Data Storytelling using Python”

Sadly, we had to cancel sessions:

  • “Hacking the Crystal Ball: Simplifying Time Series Forecasting with Skforecast” by Joaquin Amat Rodrigo
  • “Explainable AI: Demystifying Complex Models with Shapley Values” by Neeraj Pandey

We had to move some sessions, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Getting started with (modern) Python packaging” by Filipe Laíns (Sept. 8, 2023, 5:40 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 5:30 p.m.)
  • “Debugging and Troubleshooting Python Applications: Leveraging Visibility and Observability to Solve Problems Faster” by Neeraj Pandey (Sept. 8, 2023, 3:25 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 3:15 p.m.)
  • “Django Apps at Scale: Mistakes to Avoid” by Kushal Vijay (Sept. 8, 2023, 4:30 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 4:20 p.m.)
  • “Faster Python with friends” by Murilo Cunha (Sept. 8, 2023, 2:50 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 2:40 p.m.)
  • “Practical Guide to Database Locks with Django” by Efe Öge (Sept. 8, 2023, 12:05 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 11:55 a.m.)
  • “Image recognition using Python, PyTorch, OpenAI and Streamlit in Snowflake” by Dash (Sept. 9, 2023, 5 p.m., Workshop II → Sept. 9, 2023, 11:30 a.m., Workshop I)
  • “Living and breathing backwards compatible changes” by Leandro Damascena, Henrique Graça (Sept. 8, 2023, 11:30 a.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 11:20 a.m.)
  • “Building Dainty Dashboards in Plotly Dash for health data science.” by Avneet Kaur (Sept. 8, 2023, 6:15 p.m. → Sept. 7, 2023, 11:55 a.m.)
  • “CPython Survival Kit: basic C concepts to understand Python better” by Cristián Maureira-Fredes (Sept. 8, 2023, 10:25 a.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 10:15 a.m.)
  • “The Aesthetics of Unbiased Machine Learning Systems: Crafting Fairness in Practice” by Rashmi Nagpal (Sept. 8, 2023, 2:15 p.m. → Sept. 7, 2023, 3:15 p.m.)
  • “Mastering comprehensions” by Rodrigo Girão Serrão (Sept. 9, 2023, 11:30 a.m., Auditorium → Sept. 9, 2023, 5 p.m., Workshop II)
  • “Boosting up your tests: property-based testing workshop” by Felix Mino (Sept. 9, 2023, 2:30 p.m., Workshop II → Sept. 9, 2023, 5 p.m., Workshop I)
  • “"PYTHON IN QISKIT ENVIROMENTS FOR QUANTUM COMPUTING"” by Francisco Lavrador Pires (Sept. 8, 2023, 12:40 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 12:30 p.m.)
  • “Esmerald and Saffier - Complex Python made it easy with async” by Tiago Silva, Pedro Correia (Sept. 8, 2023, 5:05 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 4:55 p.m.)
  • “Lightning Talks” (Sept. 8, 2023, 6:50 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 6:05 p.m.)
  • “I know Polars is fast, but my data pipelines are written in pandas!” by Luca Baggi (Sept. 7, 2023, 3:15 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 2:05 p.m.)
  • “MicroPython and time series analysis: Forecasting and trend analysis” by Olaniyan Adewale, Sulaiman Adisa Adigun (Workshop I → Auditorium)

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.2)
entry.summary:
A new PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version! Almost all content available, some changes might happen, but minor ones.

We have new sessions!

  • “Building Dainty Dashboards in Plotly Dash for health data science.”
  • “Image recognition using Python, PyTorch, OpenAI and Streamlit in Snowflake”
  • “MicroPython and time series analysis: Forecasting and trend analysis”

We had to move some sessions, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Mastering comprehensions” by Rodrigo Girão Serrão (Workshop I → Auditorium)
  • “Lightning Talks” (Sept. 8, 2023, 6:15 p.m. → Sept. 8, 2023, 6:50 p.m.)

entry.title: New PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule released (0.1)
entry.summary:
The first PyCon Portugal 2023 schedule has been released!

We released our first schedule! Please notice this is the first draft, we are still waiting for some speakers availability confirmations!
